item.title: Kelly add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Lao Tsu
item.description: "Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know." -- Lao Tsu

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "The best way to get even with anyone is to put them in the rearview mirror on your way to something better." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Daniel Quinn
item.description: "If the world is saved, it will not be saved by old minds with new programs but by new minds with no programs at all." -- Daniel Quinn

item.title: Kelly add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "It is in vain to say human beings ought to be satisfied with tranquility: they must have action; and they will make it if they cannot find it." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "I don’t live in either my past or my future. I’m interested only in the present. If you can concentrate always on the present, you’ll be a happy man. Life will be a party for you, a grand festival, because life is the moment we’re living now." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Tove Jansson
item.description: "One summer morning at sunrise a long time ago I met a little girl with a book under her arm. I asked her why she was out so early and she answered that there were too many books and far too little time. And there she was absolutely right." -- Tove Jansson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "It's so easy to laugh It's so easy to hate It takes guts to be gentle and kind" -- Morrissey

item.title: Kelly add a quote by e.e cummings
item.description: "most people are perfectly afraid of silence" -- e.e cummings

item.title: Kelly add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "The most exhausting thing in life, I have discovered, is being insincere." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting." -- John Green

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Michael A. Singer
item.description: "If you truly love someone, your love sees past their humanness" -- Michael A. Singer

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran
